lead_paragraph: The C.D.C. advisory for pregnant women to avoid more than a dozen Latin American countries comes only a few months before the start of the Olympic Games in Brazil.

byline.contributor: Michael Shear contributed reporting from Washington, and Elisabeth Malkin from Mexico City.

headline.main: Zika Warning Spotlights Latin America’s Fight Against Mosquito-Borne Diseases

snippet: The C.D.C. advisory for pregnant women to avoid more than a dozen Latin American countries comes only a few months before the start of the Olympic Games in Brazil.
abstract: Brazil and other Latin American countries are struggling to contain surge in mosquito-borne diseases, including Zika, virus that causes infant brain damage; Centers for Disease Control and Prevention warning against travel to region has prompted pushback from some authorities and applause from others who welcome international attention to plight.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
